text: William Raymond Healy (March 28, 1924 – September 22, 2010) was an All- American college football player for the Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets. He graduated from Baylor School in 1942 and served in the 88th Cavalry reconnaissance squadron in the European Theater during World War II. He was awarded the Silver Star and the Bronze Star for gallantry in action. At Georgia Tech, he was a five-sport letterman. He was a member of the Chattanooga Sports Hall of Fame, Georgia Tech Hall of Fame and the Georgia Sports Hall of Fame. Healy was selected by the Associated Press for an all- time SEC team in 1950. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets football players Category:American football guards Category:All-American college football players Category:Sportspeople from New Brunswick, New Jersey
title: Bill Healy
